brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective of the SONR-ECHO trial is to demonstrate that optimization of CRT
      parameters by SonR technology is able to increase the rate of CRT-D responders, based on
      significant LV reverse remodeling, as compared to Standard of Care settings.

      This study will also evaluate the effectiveness of CRT-D SonR system as compared to Standard
      of care (SoC) programming methods in providing appropriate LV filling, as expected from the
      Ritter method.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Assessment of the SonR Algorithm in the PARADYM RF SonR CRT-D by Echocardiography

facility.name: Institut universitaire de Cardiologie et Pneumologie de Québec

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Assessment of the SonR Algorithm in the PARADYM RF SonR CRT-D by Echocardiography

other_outcome.measure: Report LV remodeling from LVEDV decrease at M6 / baseline

authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.measure: CRT-responders rate increase based on LVESV decrease at M6 / baseline

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor)
